intro: Oldenlandia stocksii, commonly known as the silverleaf spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in clusters along the stems. The plant has opposite, narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The genus Oldenlandia is part of the family Rubiaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with similar botanical features.
